alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 5:57AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS ON RIVERS, STREAMS, AND CREEKS DRAINING THE WESTERN BROOKS RANGE... More rain today through Saturday for the Upper Kobuk, and Noatak basins. Water levels will continue to rise with an increase in debris flow in the rivers. Additional rainfall amounts will range up to 2.5 inches. High water levels are expected to only impact small streams and creeks, but the Kobuk River at Kiana is expected to rise significantly over the next several days. No major flooding is expected for the mainstem rivers. Those traveling and recreating on rivers and streams draining the Western Brooks Range are encouraged to monitor water levels since some exposed gravel bars could become inundated due to runoff from the rainfall. For the latest weather forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks, and for the latest river forecasts go to www.weather.gov/aprfc.

area.areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys
